p.s: I'm writing this, but I can't even hold the pen, as I'm too angry.
As I wrote in my last entry I told you that I was going to visit my uncle today.
After the situation in the coffeshopcoffeeshop and my latest arrest, Emily forced me to go and ask Amir for advice.
So I did.
Even though I was scared, as I lost my whole trust in him after he beat up Emily, I went there.
But I now know that I should have been smarter.
If I hadn't go to him I wouldn't have been so angry.
It started off, as I told him the situation.
I talked about my immigration status and how it is up for renewal.
I also mentioned that I eventually laughed at the officers.
Look, I should have known that this would offend him.
He told me how I have to change my behaviour in order to fit in society and how otherwise I won't have a future in this country.
But what if I don't want to?
Amir always seemed perfectly integrated in American society.
But now I know, that he always tried to assimilate.
He turned his back on everything that's in relation to the Islam.
But not only on things, but on humans.
I can't describe how hurt I was all those years.
But now I know why.
He didn't only want to fit in American society but the discomfort of belonging to the Islam goes way deeper.
He was ashamed.
Ashamed that he, just like all of us, felt this immense pride for our religion.
The blush you get when someone talks about terroristic attacks.
Attacks where our people stood up for the religion and outlived it.
He tried to be an American so hard and forced himself in this position, that his mind probably went crazy.
But then I just simply don't understand how he could say that I'm a radical muslim.
This just isn't fair.
From feeling nothing buth respect for Amir, I'm now feeling shame for the fact that I'm related to him.
Call me crazy, but I don't want and need his help.
Even if without him or his stupid lawyer friends help, I won't be able to get out of this situation, I won't accept help.
I stood up for my country and religion in the best way possible.
He should pay me respect, not the other way around.
I don't belong here, I never will.
I don't need to face racism on a daily base and don't stand up for my self like Amir does, that's just not me.
Who knows what the future will hold.
I won't let myself be suppressed any longer.
I hope Amir will find a way to make up his mind because otherwise he'll never be happy.
He already lost his wife and job... I don't have anything to looselose... So I don't really care.
Goodbye diary.
I'll meet my friends now and go pray.
Show some respect to my religion.
